department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
short_summary: The Department of National Defence (DND) require selective demolition and implementation of cooling systems including ancillary modification to systems and building components located in Building B175 at the Halifax Dockyard.
description: Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) on behalf of the Department of National Defence (DND) has a requirement for selective demolition and implementation of cooling systems serving two blast booths, including ancillary modification to systems and building components located in Building D175 at the Halifax Dockyard. TWO PHASE SELECTION PROCESS This is the first phase (Phase One) of a two-phase process: the first phase will evaluate the qualifications of all interested suppliers; the second phase (Phase Two) will invite the qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings. The qualification list will expire within 60 days or upon award of a contract in Phase Two, whichever is earlier, and the prequalification list will not be used in any other solicitation  INQUIRIES: All inquiries of a technical nature and all questions of a contractual nature are to be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority: Kate Mintzer.Email: kate.mintzer@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca  Inquiries are to be made in writing and should be received no less than five (5) calendar days prior to the closing date to allow sufficient time to respond.
full_summary:
### EB144-250487 - ITQ for D175 Blast Booth Cooling Upgrade

#### Tender Details
* **Title (English) / Titre (French)**: EB144-250487 - ITQ - D175 Blast Booth Cooling Upgrade - EB144-250487 - ISQ - Mise à niveau du refroidissement de la cabine de sablage D175
* **Reference Number**: WS4709975190-Doc4709993385
* **Amendment Number**: 0
* **Solicitation Number**: WS4709975190
* **Publication Date**: 2024-07-29
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2024-08-13T14:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: 2024-09-15

#### Solicitation Overview

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) is seeking a supplier to undertake selective demolition and implementation of cooling systems serving two blast booths in Building D175 at the Halifax Dockyard. This is the first phase of a two-phase selection process.

#### Bidding Requirements

* **Pre-Qualification**: Interested suppliers must provide documentation to demonstrate their capacity and qualifications for the project.
* **Bidding Phase**: Qualified suppliers will be invited to provide a financial bid on the project, based on the specifications and drawings.
* **Notice**: Inquiries of a technical nature and contractual nature must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority: Kate Mintzer (kate.mintzer@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca) at least 5 days prior to the closing date.

#### Tender Procedure

Procurement will be conducted in accordance with the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the Canadian Government Trade Agreement. The region of opportunity is Nova Scotia, and the expected contract duration has not been established.

#### Important Dates
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2024-08-13T14:00:00
* **Notice Version Number**: NT-150-00300187 (C)

The rewritten text is concise, objective, and free of ambiguity. I also included relevant details and dates.
